IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: TO PROVIDE A BROAD RANGE OF PROGRAMS AND SERVICES DESIGNED TO PROVIDE FOR THE OVERALL HEALTH, VITALITY AND PRODUCTIVITY OF INDIVIDUALS, FAMILIES, AND ORGANIZATIONS.
IRS990.MissionDesc: MAKING A DIFFERENCE: IMPROVING QUALITY OF LIFE THROUGH EXCELLENCE IN SERVICE.
IRS990.Desc: BEHAVIORAL HEALTH SERVICES: CHESTNUT HEALTH SYSTEMS OFFERS SUBSTANCE USE DISORDER (SUD), MENTAL HEALTH, AND PREVENTION SERVICES IN CENTRAL AND SOUTHERN ILLINOIS. PROGRAM SITES ARE LOCATED IN MCLEAN, MADISON, ST. CLAIR, WILL, AND MACON COUNTIES. SUD TREATMENT IS AVAILABLE FOR ADOLESCENTS AND ADULTS. SERVICES INCLUDE MEDICALLY-MONITORED DETOX, RESIDENTIAL TREATMENT, AND OUTPATIENT TREATMENT. MENTAL HEALTH SERVICES INCLUDE CRISIS INTERVENTION, CRISIS RESIDENTIAL, PSYCHIATRIC, AND SUPPORTED/SUPERVISED RESIDENTIAL TREATMENT. CHESTNUT OFFERS COUNSELING FOR PEOPLE STRUGGLING WITH A VARIETY OF DISORDERS AND CONDITIONS. SUD PREVENTION EFFORTS ARE FOCUSED ON TEENS.

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: LIGHTHOUSE INSTITUTE: THE MISSION OF LIGHTHOUSE INSTITUTE (LI) IS TO HELP PRACTITIONERS IMPROVE THE QUALITY OF THEIR SERVICES THROUGH RESEARCH, TRAINING, AND PUBLISHING. LI SERVES HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICE AGENCIES THROUGH OFFICES IN CHICAGO, BLOOMINGTON, AND MARYVILLE, ILLINOIS. LI STAFF CONDUCT APPLIED RESEARCH, PROGRAM EVALUATION, TRAINING, CONSULTATION, AND MANAGEMENT SERVICES. LI PUBLISHES BOOKS, MONOGRAPHS, CURRICULA, AND MANUALS ON BEHAVIORAL HEALTH, EDUCATION, AND PROGRAM MANAGEMENT.

ProgSrvcAccomActy3Grp.Desc: CHESTNUT GLOBAL PARTNERS: CHESTNUT GLOBAL PARTNERS (CGP) IS A WHOLLY-OWNED SUBSIDIARY OF CHESTNUT HEALTH SYSTEMS, INC. AND IS ORGANIZED AS A SINGLE MEMBER LIMITED LIABILITY COMPANY (LLC). BASED IN BLOOMINGTON, ILLINOIS, CGP PROVIDES EMPLOYEE ASSISTANCE PROGRAMS (EAP) AND RELATED WORKPLACE SERVICES INCLUDING HEALTH COACHING AND DISEASE MANAGEMENT, WORKPLACE TRAINING AND CONSULTATION, CRITICAL INCIDENT RESPONSE INTERVENTION, AND PROGRAM EVALUATION AND OUTCOME MEASUREMENT. CGP PROVIDES TRAINING ON BEHAVIORAL RISK AND ASSISTS WITH EMPLOYEE SATISFACTION SURVEYS, QUALITY OF LIFE, AND ATTITUDES TOWARD EMPLOYMENT.

ProgSrvcAccomActyOtherGrp.Desc: CREDIT COUNSELING: CHESTNUT CREDIT COUNSELING SERVICES (CCCS) HELPS INDIVIDUALS AND FAMILIES WITH FINANCIAL PROBLEMS THROUGH ANALYSIS OF PERSONAL FINANCES, ASSISTANCE WITH FINANCIAL PLANNING AND MONEY MANAGEMENT, AND PLANNED DEBT REPAYMENT. CCCS PROVIDES FINANCIAL EDUCATION TO CONSUMERS AND TO COMMUNITY GROUPS; HELPS COLLEGE GRADUATES DEVELOP PLANS FOR REPAYING STUDENT LOAN DEBT; AND OFFERS CREDIT COUNSELING, DEBTOR EDUCATION CLASSES, AND CERTIFICATES OF COMPLETION FOR INDIVIDUALS FILING FOR BANKRUPTCY IN ILLINOIS.

CHESTNUT FAMILY HEALTH CENTER: CHESTNUT FAMILY HEALTH CENTER (CFHC) IS A HEALTH CENTER PROGRAM GRANTEE UNDER 42 U.S.C. 254B, AND A DEEMED PUBLIC HEALTH SERVICE EMPLOYEE UNDER 43 U.S.C. 233(G)-(N). IT SERVES RESIDENTS OF MCLEAN AND MADISON COUNTIES IN ILLINOIS WHO LIVE AT OR BELOW 200 PERCENT OF FEDERAL POVERTY GUIDELINES. CFHC PROVIDES HEALTH CARE FOR PATIENTS OF ALL AGES - FROM INFANTS TO GERIATRIC PATIENTS. CFHC OFFERS PREVENTIVE SERVICES SUCH AS WELLNESS EXAMS; MANAGEMENT OF CHRONIC ILLNESSES; TREATMENT OF ACUTE ILLNESSES; AND COUNSELING SERVICES. A LABORATORY AND PHARMACY ARE LOCATED WITHIN EACH OF THE CFHC SITES.

SHARE OF UNDISTRIBUTED EARNINGS OF LIMITED LIABILITY COMPANIES AND JOINT VENTURES - INTERESTS IN FOREIGN LLC'S AND JOINT VENTURES ARE OWNED. THESE LLC'S AND JOINT VENTURES ENGAGE IN SIMILIAR ACTIVITIES, CONSISTENT WITH CHESTNUT'S MISSION.

Form990PartVIISectionAGrp.TitleTxt: CHIEF OPERATING OFFICER AND GENERAL COUNSEL

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: CHESTNUT HEALTH SYSTEMS HAS A CREDIT COUNSELING PROGRAM WITH A SEPARATE BANK ACCOUNT TO DEPOSIT CLIENT PAYMENTS. CHESTNUT HEALTH SYSTEMS ALSO HAS AN SSI PAYEESHIP PROGRAM. EACH CLIENT HAS THEIR OWN CHECKING ACCOUNT. THESE AMOUNTS ARE SHOWN AS AN ASSET AND A LIABILITY FOR CLIENT DEPOSITS THAT HAVE NOT BEEN PAID.

CHESTNUT HAS RECEIVED A TAX DETERMINATION LETTER FROM THE INTERNAL REVENUE SERVICE STATING THAT CHESTNUT QUALIFIES UNDER THE PROVISIONS OF SECTION 501(C)(3) OF THE CODE AND IS EXEMPT FROM FEDERAL INCOME TAXES. AS SUCH, CHESTNUT IS SUBJECT TO FEDERAL INCOME TAXES ONLY ON ANY NET UNRELATED BUSINESS INCOME UNDER THE PROVISIONS OF SECTION 511 OF THE CODE. CHESTNUT FILES A FORM 990 (RETURN OF ORGANIZATION EXEMPT FROM INCOME TAX) ANNUALLY. WHEN THESE RETURNS ARE FILED, IT IS HIGHLY CERTAIN THAT SOME POSITIONS TAKEN WOULD BE SUSTAINED UPON EXAMINATION BY THE TAXING AUTHORITIES, WHILE OTHERS ARE SUBJECT TO UNCERTAINTY ABOUT THE MERITS OF THE TAX POSITION TAKEN OR THE AMOUNT OF THE POSITION THAT WOULD ULTIMATELY BE SUSTAINED. EXAMPLES OF TAX POSITIONS COMMON TO ORGANIZATIONS INCLUDE SUCH MATTERS AS THE FOLLOWING: THE TAX-EXEMPT STATUS OF EACH ENTITY AND VARIOUS POSITIONS RELATIVE TO POTENTIAL SOURCES OF UNRELATED BUSINESS TAXABLE INCOME (UBIT). UBIT IS REPORTED ON FORM 990-T, AS APPROPRIATE. THE BENEFIT OF A TAX POSITION IS RECOGNIZED IN THE CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS IN THE PERIOD DURING WHICH, BASED ON ALL AVAILABLE EVIDENCE, MANAGEMENT BELIEVES THAT IT IS MORE LIKELY THAN NOT THAT THE POSITION WILL BE SUSTAINED UPON EXAMINATION, INCLUDING THE RESOLUTION OF APPEALS OR LITIGATION PROCESSES, IF ANY. TAX POSITIONS ARE NOT OFFSET OR AGGREGATED WITH OTHER POSITIONS. TAX POSITIONS THAT MEET THE "MORE LIKELY THAN NOT" RECOGNITION THRESHOLD ARE MEASURED AS THE LARGEST AMOUNT OF TAX BENEFIT THAT IS MORE THAN 50% LIKELY TO BE REALIZED ON SETTLEMENT WITH THE APPLICABLE TAXING AUTHORITY. THE PORTION OF THE BENEFITS ASSOCIATED WITH TAX POSITIONS TAKEN THAT EXCEEDS THE AMOUNT MEASURED AS DESCRIBED ABOVE IS REFLECTED AS A LIABILITY FOR UNCERTAIN TAX BENEFITS IN THE ACCOMPANYING STATEMENTS OF FINANCIAL POSITION ALONG WITH ANY ASSOCIATED INTEREST AND PENALTIES THAT WOULD BE PAYABLE TO THE TAXING AUTHORITIES UPON EXAMINATION. THERE WERE NO UNCERTAIN TAX BENEFITS IDENTIFIED AND RECORDED AS A LIABILITY AS OF JUNE 30, 2018 AND 2017.

AccountActivitiesOutsideUSGrp.RegionTxt: SOUTH ASIA - AFGHANISTAN, BANGLADESH, BHUTAN, INDIA, MALDIVES, NEPAL,
EUROPE (INCLUDING ICELAND & GREENLAND) - ALBANIA, ANDORRA, AUSTRIA, BELGIUM
NORTH AMERICA - CANADA AND MEXICO, BUT BUT NOT THE UNITED STATES

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: SCHEDULE F, PART I, LINE 3, D & E
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE PURPOSE OF CHESTNUT GLOBAL PARTNERS IS TO DEVELOP, IMPLEMENT, AND CONDUCT RESEARCH ON STATE-OF-THE-ART BEHAVIORAL HEALTH TREATMENT PROGRAMS AND INTENSIVE CASE MANAGEMENT MODELS THROUGHOUT THE WORLD; TO PROVIDE COMPREHENSIVE DOMESTIC AND INTERNATIONAL EMPLOYEE ASSISTANCE WORKPLACE SERVICES, INCLUDING, BUT NOT LIMITED TO, COUNSELING, CASE MANAGEMENT, CRISIS INTERVENTION SERVICES, TRAINING, AND WELLNESS PROGRAMS FOR PARTICIPANTS OF VARIOUS GROUP PLANS AND SELF-INSURED EMPLOYERS, HEALTH MAINTENANCE ORGANIZATIONS, PREFERRED PROVIDER ORGANIZATIONS, INSURANCE, LABOR TRUSTS, ERISA PLANS, AND GOVERNMENTS; TO PARTICIPATE IN THE CREATION OF COMPREHENSIVE MANAGED BEHAVIORAL CARE NETWORKS THAT PROVIDE A FULL CONTINUUM OF SERVICES AND PROGRAMS FOR ADULTS, ADOLESCENTS, CHILDREN, AND FAMILIES; AND TO CONDUCT AND PROVIDE RESEARCH, TRAINING, SCIENTIFIC STUDIES, AND EDUCATION IN THE BEHAVIORAL HEALTH CARE FIELD. THE ACTIVITIES ARE CONDUCTED AS SEPARATE JOINT VENTURES AND RESULTED IN TOTAL BUSINESS INCOME/(LOSS) OF $(395,550) ($(211,546) FROM EAST ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, $(19,982) FROM SOUTH ASIA, $(230,330) FROM SOUTH AMERICA, $(3,493) FROM RUSSIA, $56,915 FROM EUROPE, AND $12,886 FROM NORTH AMERICA). ON DECEMBER 1, 2017, CHESTNUT HEALTH SYSTEMS SOLD ITS INVESTMENTS IN CHESTNUT GLOBAL PARTNERS (CGP). CHESTNUT HEALTH SYSTEMS SOLD ITS OWNERSHIP STAKE IN FIVE JOINT VENTURE COMPANIES IN BRAZIL, CHINA, EASTERN EUROPE, INDIA, AND RUSSIA. ABOVE INCOME IS THROUGH THE DATE SOLD.
ON DECEMBER 1, 2017, CHESTNUT HEALTH SYSTEMS SOLD ITS INVESTMENT IN CHESTNUT GLOBAL PARTNERS, WHICH WAS FORMERLY ONE OF THE ORGANIZATIONS LARGEST PROGRAMS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE AUDIT COMMITTEE WILL REVIEW THE 990 AND REPORT TO THE BOARD PRIOR TO THE FILING OF THE 990.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: EVERY YEAR EACH MEMBER OF THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS IS REQUIRED TO EXECUTE A "CONFLICT OF INTEREST STATEMENT AND EACH MEMBER OF THE EXECUTIVE LEADERSHIP COUNCIL IS REQUIRED TO EXECUTE AN "ANNUAL POTENTIAL CONFLICT OF INTEREST DISCLOSURE STATEMENT."

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE CEO RECEIVES AN ANNUAL PERFORMANCE EVALUATION FROM THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS, ALL OF WHOM ARE UNPAID VOLUNTEERS. THE BOARD CHAIRPERSON SOLICITS INPUT INTO THE EVALUATION WITH SPECIFIC QUESTIONS AND ISSUES POSED TO BOARD MEMBERS, EXECUTIVES, OTHER KEY MANAGEMENT, AS WELL AS THE CEO. THE EVALUATION IS THEN ASSEMBLED AND WRITTEN BY THE BOARD EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE, COMPRISED OF DISINTERESTED DIRECTORS AND SUBMITTED TO THE FULL BOARD FOR REVIEW AND DISCUSSION OUTSIDE OF THE PRESENCE OF THE CEO. CEO COMPENSATION IS RESEARCHED ANNUALLY BY CORPORATE COUNSEL AND A REPORT IS SUBMITTED TO THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS. COUNSEL COMPILES OBJECTIVE SALARY SURVEYS CONTAINING COMPARATIVE DATA FROM MULTIPLE RESOURCES FOR CEO COMPENSATION FOR OTHER BEHAVIORAL HEALTHCARE ORGANIZATIONS AND NOT-PROFIT ORGANIZATIONS ON A LOCAL, STATEWIDE, AND NATIONAL BASIS AS WELL AS REVIEWS FORM 990 OF SIMILARLY SITUATED ORGANIZATIONS. THE REPORT ALSO INCLUDES A DISCUSSION OF MARKET AND ECONOMIC TRENDS IN CEO COMPENSATION. THIS COMPARABILITY DATA IS USED AND RELIED UPON BY THE BOARD. THE BOARD THEN THOROUGHLY DOCUMENTS ITS RATIONALE AND THE REASONABLENESS OF THE COMPENSATION IN A COMBINATION OF THE FOLLOWING DOCUMENTS: THE PERFORMANCE EVALUATION, COMPENSATION REPORTS, EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE MINUTES AND BOARD OF DIRECTORS MINUTES. THE COMPENSATION OF OTHER OFFICERS OR KEY EMPLOYEES IS REVIEWED VIA THE STANDARD ANNUAL EMPLOYEE PERFORMANCE EVALUATION PROCESS WHICH IS WRITTEN BY THE CEO OR OTHER MEMBERS OF EXECUTIVE MANAGEMENT. PAY ADJUSTMENTS ARE DETERMINED BY PERFORMANCE, BUDGET GUIDELINES, AND INTERNAL AND MARKET FACTORS. THE DIRECTOR OF HUMAN RESOURCES REVIEWS ALL EVALUATIONS AND COMPENSATION ADJUSTMENTS FOR EMPLOYEES IN THIS CATEGORY. INTERNAL AND MARKET ANALYSIS OF THESE POSITIONS BY HUMAN RESOURCES OCCURS ON A PERIODIC BASIS OR AT THE REQUEST OF THE CEO.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: CERTAIN DOCUMENTS WILL BE MADE AVAILABLE FOR PUBLIC INSPECTION ACCORDING TO CHESTNUT HEALTH SYSTEMS' POLICY.

MANAGEMENT AND GENERAL EXPENSES -11,949. FUNDRAISING EXPENSES 0. TOTAL EXPENSES 188,597. OUTSIDE PRINTING/ARTWORK: PROGRAM SERVICE EXPENSES 59,402. MANAGEMENT AND GENERAL EXPENSES 756.
